page.title: 18Roadside Cafes.
page.content: A caravan selling refreshments has become a common feature along the main roads.On e such is in the lay-by at Ducksworth.They are mobile,have no planning permission (and would be unlikely to receive it) are not connected to services and therefore pay no rates.They are required in North Bedfordshire to register with the health authorities,who inspect them and their home base where food is prepared and have to conform to hygiene regulations.e.g.they must have a hot and pumped-up water supply for washing,and display a name outside. They are popular with lorry drivers on long hauls whose large lorries cannot be catered for in urban areas.Their main problem is ensuring they meet standards and litter in surrounding fields and ditches.
